Detailed Description

To communicate with other Bluetooth devices the Bluetooth stack must know that there are other Bluetooth devices ready for communication. To get knowledgs about other devices the Bluetooth stack supports an operation that is called inquiry or device search. This is exactly the operation that BtDeviceSearchRequest initiates on exectution.

Member Function Documentation

BOOLEAN BtDeviceSearchRequest::Cancel (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Set controller parameters and call stack to cancel operation.

The Cancel member function is responsible for setting the appropriate parameters and perform the call to the controllers function, that cancels an ongoing operation at the Bluetooth Stack. This function is pure virtual because each request is canceled in a different way and this has to be implemented by the concrete Bt...Request class.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceSearchRequest::Execute (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Sumbit this request to the Bluetooth Stack.

Execute instructs this request to send itself to the Bluetooth Stack for execution purposes.
In the base class of all Bluetooth Requests - BtRequest - there is an interface defined, that all requests must fullfill respectively implement. Some functions in this interface are declared pure virtual because they can not be implemented in the base classes. Execute is one of these functions.Because the execution of various requests differ very strong, the implmentation of this function is done by the various concrete request classes.

Returns:
TRUE: The setup of the stack parameters was successfull and the Bluetooth stack accepted the requested operation.
FALSE: Either the setup of the stack parameters failed or the Bluetooth stack rejected the requested operation.

Implements BtRequest.

BtDeviceAndServiceClass BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetDeviceAndServiceClass (   )  const
 

Which kind of devices should be found?

GetDeviceAndServiceClass returns the device and serivce class bits for the remote devices which the request should search on the air.

Returns:
A BtDeviceAndServiceClass object containing the device and service class bits that should be found on the air.

const BtDeviceList & BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetDeviceList (   )  const
 

Get the list of found devices.

GetDeviceList returns the list of devices found during the execution of this request.

Returns:
A reference to a BtDeviceList containing all devices that where found during the exectution of this request.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetImmediatlyRetrieveRemoteDeviceNames (   )  const
 

BtInquiryAccessCode BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetInquiryAccessCode (   )  const
 

Which kind of inquiry should be made?

GetInquiryAccessCode returns the type of inquiry or device search should be done. See the Bluetooth Global Access Profile for further information on Inquiry Access Codes.

Returns:
A BtInquiryAccessCode containig the type of inquiry or device search that should be done.

UINT8 BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetInquiryTimeOut (   )  const
 

How long should the device search last at most?

GetInquiryTimeOut returns the timeout period after which the request should stop searching. There are two conditions to stop the device search: the numer of devices to find and the time the device search to run. If one condition is satisfied the device search stops.
Unit of timeout: 1 = 1.28s = 2048 baseband slots a 625 ´s

Returns:
An UINT8 containing the time out period after which the request should stop searching.

UINT8 BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetMaximalFoundDevices (   )  const
 

How many devices should be found at most?

GetMaximalFoundDevices returns the number remote devices after which the request should stop searching. There are two conditions to stop the device search: the numer of devices to find and the time the device search to run. If one condition is satisfied the device search stops.

Returns:
An UINT8 containing the number of remote devices after which the request should stop searching.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetQueryRemoteDeviceName (   )  const
 

Should the remote device name be retrieved during the inquiry?

GetQueryRemoteDeviceName returns wheter the device name for the remote devices found on the air should be retrieved or not.

Returns:
TRUE: The remote device name should be queried by the Bluetooth stack.
FALSE: The remote device name should not be queried by the Bluetooth stack.

BtRequestType BtDeviceSearchRequest::GetRequestType (   )  const [virtual]
 

Get type of this request.

The runtime type information feature is not supported by all compilers which this framework is used with. So a rudimentary type information system is implemnted by this class. Each type of request that has no subtypes (leaf class) must return an unique type identifier. GetRuestType return this type idenifier which is implemented as an enumeration type.

Returns:
A BtRequestType containing the type that describes this request.

Implements BtRequest.

BOOLEAN BtDeviceSearchRequest::OnMessage (  const Message &  message  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Message dispatching member function.

The OnMessage member function is the first entry point in every dispatcher for the reception of messages. From there on it will be routed to the appropriate On... member function, if it should be handled by this dispatcher or passed back to the superior dispatcher.

Returns:
TRUE: The received message has be handle. No further handling for the message is needed.
FALSE: The received message is not handled by this dispatcher. Route it forward to the next dispatcher.

Implements BtLocalRequest.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::OnRemoteDeviceFound (  const BtDevice &  remote_device,
const BtDeviceAndServiceClass &  remote_device_and_service_class,
UINT8  signal_strength
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Remote device found message handler member function.

The OnRemoteDeviceFound member function will be invoked when a BtRemoteDeviceFoundMessage is received by this request. This member function is used to enable some reactions to the receipt of the aforsaid message.
The implmenetation of this member function is a dummy implementation and does nothing. If the application programmer wants to change this behaviour, he has to overload this function in a derived class. He need not to call the inherited base function, because it does nothing.

Parameters:
remote_device A reference to a BtDevice containing the device that was found on the air and initiated the message.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::OnRemoteDeviceFound (  const BtDevice &  remote_device,
const BtDeviceAndServiceClass &  remote_device_and_service_class
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Remote device found message handler member function.

The OnRemoteDeviceFound member function will be invoked when a BtRemoteDeviceFoundMessage is received by this request. This member function is used to enable some reactions to the receipt of the aforsaid message.
The implmenetation of this member function is a dummy implementation and does nothing. If the application programmer wants to change this behaviour, he has to overload this function in a derived class. He need not to call the inherited base function, because it does nothing.

Parameters:
remote_device A reference to a BtDevice containing the device that was found on the air and initiated the message.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::OnRemoteDeviceName (  const BtDevice &  remote_device,
const WString &  remote_device_name
)  [protected, virtual]
 

Remote device name received message handler member function.

The OnRemoteDeviceName member function will be invoked when a BtRemoteDeviceNameMessage is received by this request. This member function is used to enable some reactions to the receipt of the aforsaid message.
The implmenetation of this member function is a dummy implementation and does nothing. If the application programmer wants to change this behaviour, he has to overload this function in a derived class. He need not to call the inherited base function, because it does nothing.

Parameters:
remote_device A reference to a BtDevice containing the device for which the name was received.
remote_device_name A reference to a WString containing the received remote device name.

Reimplemented in BtApplicationDeviceSearchRequest.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::RegisterMessages (  void   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Register the required messages for receipt.

After registering itself at an application, the request has to tell the message dispatching mechanism which messages this request is intersted in. RegisterMessage performs this task. For the BtDeviceSearchRequest the following messages are registered: BtDeviceSearchMessage, BtRemoteDeviceMessage, BtRemoteDeviceNameMessage and BtCancelSearchMessage.

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::SetDeviceAndServiceClass (  BtDeviceAndServiceClass  device_and_service_class  ) 
 

Set kind of devices that should be found.

GetDeviceAndServiceClass sets the device and serivce class bits for the remote devices which the request should search on the air.

Parameters:
device_and_service_class A BtDeviceAndServiceClass containing the device and service class bit that should be found on the air.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::SetImmediatlyRerieveRemoteDeviceNames (  BOOLEAN  immediatly_rerieve_names  ) 
 

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::SetInquiryAccessCode (  BtInquiryAccessCode  inquiry_access_code  ) 
 

Set the kind of inquiry that should be made.

GetInquiryAccessCode sets the type of inquiry or device search should be done. See the Bluetooth Global Access Profile for further information on Inquiry Access Codes.

Parameters:
inquiry_access_code A BtInquiryAccessCode containig the type of inquiry or device search that should be done.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::SetInquiryTimeOut (  UINT8  inquiry_time_out = 0  ) 
 

Set how long the device search should last at most.

SetInquiryTimeOut sets the timeout period after which the request should stop searching. There are two conditions to stop the device search: the numer of devices to find and the time the device search to run. If one condition is satisfied the device search stops.
Unit of timeout: 1 = 1.28s = 2048 baseband slots a 625 ´s

Parameters:
inquiry_time_out An UINT8 containing the timeout period after which the request should stop searching. Allowed values range from 1 to 48 (1 minute). All other values cause an error.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::SetMaximalFoundDevice (  UINT8  maximal_found_devices = 0  ) 
 

Set how many devices should be found at most.

SetMaximalFoundDevices sets the number remote devices after which the request should stop searching. There are two conditions to stop the device search: the numer of devices to find and the time the device search to run. If one condition is satisfied the device search stops.

Parameters:
maximal_found_devices An UINT8 containing the number of remote devices after which the request should stop searching. Specifying 0 means that the stack should get as much devices as it can store.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::SetQueryRemoteDeviceName (  BOOLEAN  query_remote_device_name  ) 
 

Set wether the remote device name should be retrieved or not.

GetQueryRemoteDeviceName sets wheter the device name for the remote devices found on the air should be retrieved or not.

Parameters:
query_remote_device_name A BOOLEAN containing whether the names of the remote devices found on the air should be queried or not.

void BtDeviceSearchRequest::UnregisterMessages (  void   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Unregister the required messages from receipt.

Before unregistering itself from the application, the request has to remove the messages, it is interested in form the message dispatching mechanism. UnregisterMessage performs this task. For the BtDeviceSearchRequest the following messages are unregistered: BtDeviceSearchMessage, BtRemoteDeviceMessage, BtRemoteDeviceNameMessage and BtCancelSearchMessage.

Reimplemented from UserDispatcher.
